info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 11:03PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern and south central Graham County through 1145 PM MST... At 1101 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roper Lake State Park, or 11 miles southwest of Safford, moving northwest at 10 mph. Additional storms were developing in the area. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Safford, Thatcher, Solomon, Roper Lake State Park, Safford Regional Airport, Pima, Central, Swift Trail Junction, Mount Graham and Frye Mesa Dam. This includes the following highways... Route 70 between mile markers 313 and 355. Route 191 between mile markers 109 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
